jobDescription: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant’s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant’s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  Navigant Life Sciences is the Life Science strategic consulting arm of the Navigant’s Healthcare Practice. Our clients include companies in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, drug delivery and diagnostic industries. Examples of Navigant Life Science’s diverse consulting assignments include therapeutic area strategy development, product opportunity assessments, commercial strategy, business development search and evaluations, due diligence, market access strategy, new product launch planning and positioning, and payer landscape assessments. Our clients are worldwide and range in size from start-ups to multi-nationals. Navigant Life Science’s culture is distinguished by its collegial, team approach. We value hard work of the highest quality and also encourage creativity, entrepreneurship, and having fun.  Senior Consultants contribute to all levels of the consulting process and are responsible for the day-to-day management of consulting assignments including regular interactions with clients. Specific responsibilities include: analyzing scientific, clinical, financial and strategic information to discerning the business implications of new technologies and emerging trends; conducting primary research interviews with clinicians, thought leaders, and executives in the healthcare industry and related fields; managing and mentoring junior staff; and preparing and presenting written reports to Navigant senior management and clients. Travel is project dependent but averages 15 to 20 percent.
